glsa.title: netkit-telnetd: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: The netkit-telnetd telnet client is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, which could allow a malicious telnet server operator to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: netkit-telnetd provides standard Linux telnet client and server.

description.p: A buffer overflow has been identified in the slc_add_reply() function of netkit-telnetd client, where a large number of SLC commands can overflow a fixed size buffer.

impact.p: Successful explotation would require a vulnerable user to connect to an attacker-controlled host using telnet, potentially executing arbitrary code with the permissions of the telnet user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All netkit-telnetd users should upgrade to the latest version:
